data.title: They've upped their game
data.text: I've been to the Dark Horse several times for happy hour with co-workers and friends. The house wine is from a box, which I don't really mind, at least it's fresh. They have a weird policy about ordering food before a certain time to get the happy hour price. I've had the shrimp tacos, nice flavors, and I was going to order them again when I found out they took the Jo Jo potatoes off the menu and added fries, I had to try them. OMG, right to the top of my favorite fries list. Two glasses of Chardonnay and a HUGE plate of fries cost me $13.00. Wow!

data.title: Fun atmosphere!
data.text: We had some time before a wedding and decided to have a drink at the Dark Horse Bar & Eatery around the corner from the venue.  The bartender was very friendly and the atmosphere a great mixture of casual bar, sports on TV, and quiet enough that our group could actually talk.  All we ate were the french fries but they were delicious.

data.title: Hip atmosphere, mediocre food
data.text: Went to Dark Horse Bar on a Saturday night for dinner.  The old warehouse type atmosphere was trendy and hip, but unfortunately the food was disappointing.  Some of us tried the burgers, which were a bit on the dry side with no distinct flavors.  Some of us tried other items on the menu that did not fare any better.  We also tried 3 of the desserts and none were any good.  Maybe OK for drinks and appetizers, but for dinner I would not recommend.

data.title: Good for Saturday Brunch
data.text: We met friends for brunch on a Saturday, and it was not horribly busy so we got great service. The food was wonderful, yet not so much that you are overstaffed. The atmosphere is fun and a little grouchy, and we sat in the window watching the world go by. I'd highly recommend the restaurant for a relaxing brunch in St. Paul.

data.title: Great!
data.text: We tried to go across the street but there was a 40 minute wait and was suggested to try the Dark Horse and wow, what a suggestion.  Four of us had brunch and we were all please with our selections, Breakfast burrito, tostada, Beinet and biscuits and gravy.  Our server, Baily was fabulous!  She offered great suggestions and was great.  Can't wait to go back again, love the funky environment!

data.title: Love the interior, food needs work
data.text: Very cool interior and patio. Fun vibe. We were impressed with the menu, however the food 2 of us ordered was lacking.  I had the Red Dragon Rice bowl. The presentation made my mouth water, but the first bite was disappointing. Unfortunately I think they must use minute rice in the bowls. Terrible. My friend had the same reaction to her Coconut Lime rice bowl. Our other friend ordered the kimchi burger, with mac and cheese as a side. I tasted both, and thought they were much better than my choice.  We may give it another try sometime.

data.title: Ala carte menu
data.text: Forty beers on tap probably seventy five different bourbons in whiskeys. A little pricey but their outdoor patio was stunning we did not eat only a couple cocktails. The food that came out look delicious.

data.title: Beautiful patio
data.text: Very good food and drinks. This place has improved over the year. Their menu choices and drink options have increased. The patio is very nicely done, with sun and shade seating, and potted plants all over. Very friendly staff!

data.title: Delicious brunch in a cute patio area
data.text: Came here for brunch on Sunday and the only problem we had that so many of the things on the menu looked so good! Ended up seated in the cute patio area and between the three of us had the Malted Waffle, the posole, and the tacos. Everything was delicious and our server was chatty and lovely. If I lived in town I would be coming here often!

data.title: Awesome patio!!
data.text: Out and about before the baseball game we ended up at the Dark Horse.  It is a cool building with a lot of character.  We were seated on the patio and it was beautiful.  Not very kid friendly in our opinion, but we were able to sit in a corner to keep the little ones contained.

data.title: Cool patio
data.text: We stopped on a crisp night after the beer dabbler and sat in the patio area. The table had a nice fire in the middle which the women appreciated because it was a bit chilly after being rained on. We had a gluten free pepperoni pizza which was very good. I did note that the fire did warm my beer and water rather quickly. Not sure how to avoid that. Good service and good pizza. Would return.

data.title: Great Pizza, Appetizers, Drinks, and Service
data.text: We were here with a group of eight at about 9:00 p.m. on a Saturday night.  The Dark Horse treated us very well!  Our server was outstanding.  We had several appetizers and pizza.  The food was outstanding.  Extensive craft beer selection.  The ambience is darkish, as the name implies, with beautiful woodwork.  Also, very cool light fixtures.  The atmosphere is relaxing, yet upscale.  I highly recommend The Dark Horse Bar & Eatery!

data.title: Poor Service, good pizza
data.text: We stopped here before a Saints game and only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table for 6 (without reservations). One of the drinks we got at the bar before tasted like Vodka/Water because the Sprite was so flat. Once we got seated we waited 15 minutes and finally let the hostess know we hadn't seen a server yet. She argued with us about how long we had been waiting and shortly after had our waitress. The food was just okay. I had the gluten free pepperoni and it was by far the best thing at the table - highly recommend! I won't be back unless it's for pizza take out.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Excellent food and service. I asked that cilantro be held from my meal. Not only was that done but when it arrived the waitress had the pico de gallo on the side because it had cilantro in it. I was appreciative and impressed!

data.title: ID over done
data.text: Four of us stopped for a couple of night caps after the Saints Game. Each of us was required to show our drivers license mine was in the car one block away. All of us are in our mid sixties. We will not be back.

data.title: Patio dining
data.text: Visited with some extended family. We sat on the lovely patio out back. Fun atmosphere. Good service. Lots of interesting menu & drink options. We enjoyed the steamed dumplings (listed as appetizer but large enough for an entree) and the Cuban sandwich. Sampled one of the craft beers. Reasonable prices. I would return to eat here.

data.title: Cool decor, just 'okay' food
data.text: The place has a nice vibe, but the entree I ordered was extremely lacking in flavor. Although presentation of my Red Dragon Rice (bowl) was verynice, the rice they use is no doubt Minute rice! Mushy! The vegetables were sparse. Not impressed with my choice, but would give it another chance.

data.title: Lovely patio and great service!
data.text: We stopped in before the Saints game and had a few local craft beers and the hummus appetizer plate.  The waitress easily answered all our questions about the craft beers and the hummus place was beautifully designed and absolutely fabulous!   We will be back for more as my husband saw all the double decker burgers on a pretzel bun!

data.title: Great food and patio!
data.text: Our office is close by this spot and we love the food here!  Their cuban and home made fries with special sauce are out of this world.  Highly recommend stopping here!

data.title: Love the building and location, but the food...
data.text: The Dark Horse has a cool vibe in an old building. Nice patio, but the chairs are uncomfortable. Beer is expensive. My daughter had a glass of craft beer that was 14.00!  Food is an odd assortment. Although my cheeseburger tasted alright it basically fell apart on the plate. The bacon on it had more fat then meet. Husband had the weirdest hotdog ever-had fried green beans on it. He was not a fan. My daughter had a salad that was small and expensive. Although we did not not have any the pizza coming out and delivered to the table next to us looked good at least. The location is good, but we will probably not be back.
